Description: Limestone trial-piece or ostracon, the front has remains of two vertical registers of black-painted hieroglyphs, now smudged in places, with outline of head and red and black painted fish before; the back has remains of seven lines of thick black-painted hieratic text, with red stops, and representations of two fish, one painted in red and black.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389856) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389856)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2013, Apr - Jul, Paris, Louvre, L'Art Du Contour 2013/2014, Sept - Jan, Musée royaux d’art et d’histoire, Brussels, L'Art Du Contour
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
